Wisdom: أَخٌ تَسْتَفِيدُهُ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أَخٍ تَسْتَزِيدُهُ
enWisdom: The brother whom you benefit from is better than the brother [for] whom you increase [benefit]

Wisdom: لَا تَصْحَبْ إِلَّا عَاقِلًا تَقِيّاً وَلَا تُعَاشِرْ إِلَّا عَالِماً زَكِيّاً وَلَا تُودِعْ سِرَّكَ إِلَّا مُؤْمِناً وَفِيّاً
enWisdom: Do not accompany anyone but the intelligent and pious; and do not associate with anyone but the knowledgeable and righteous; and do not mention your secret to anyone but the trustworthy and loyal

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْجَفَاءَ فَإِنَّهُ يُفْسِدُ الْإِخَاءَ وَيُمَقِّتُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَالنَّاسِ
enWisdom: Beware of antipathy, for it corrupts brotherhood and makes one despised by Allah and the people

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تُخْرِجَ [تُحْرِجَ‏] صَدِيقَكَ إِخْرَاجاً [إِحْرَاجاً] يُخْرِجُهُ عَنْ مَوَدَّتِكَ وَاسْتَبْقِ لَهُ مِنْ أُنْسِكَ مَوْضِعاً يَثِقُ بِالرُّجُوعِ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Be careful not to drive away your friend in a way that removes all the affection he has for you, and leave some room from your friendship for him so that he may rely on returning back to it

Wisdom: إِنْ أَرَدْتَ قَطِيعَةَ أَخِيكَ فَاسْتَبْقِ لَهُ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ بَقِيَّةً يَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهَا إِنْ بَدَا لَهُ ذَلِكَ يَوْماً مَا
enWisdom: If you want to cut off ties with your brother [in faith] then leave some of your friendship for him, so that he may return to it someday if he so wishes

Wisdom: إِنِ اسْتَنَمْتَ إِلَى وَدُودِكَ فَأَحْرِزْ لَهُ مِنْ [معه‏] أَمْرِكَ وَاسْتَبْقِ لَهُ مِنْ سِرِّكَ مَا لَعَلَّكَ أَنْ تَنْدِمَ عَلَيْهِ وَقْتاً مَا
enWisdom: [Even] if you have gained confidence and trust in your close friend, safeguard some of your affairs and conceal some of your secrets [from him], for it is possible that you may regret [revealing them] at some time [in the future]

Wisdom: إِذَا أَحْبَبْتَ فَلَا تُكْثِرْ
enWisdom: When you love [something or someone] then do not be excessive [in your love]

Wisdom: تَجَنَّبُوا تَضَاغُنَ الْقُلُوبِ وَتَشَاحُنَ الصُّدُورِ وَتَدَابُرَ النُّفُوسِ وَتَخَاذُلَ الْأَيْدِي تَمْلِكُوا أَمْرَكُمْ
enWisdom: Keep away from harbouring grudges against each other, hating each other, quarrelling with one other and not lending a supporting hand to each other, [and by doing this] you will gain mastery over your affairs

Wisdom: تَنَاسَ مَسَاوِيَ الْإِخْوَانِ تَسْتَدِمْ وُدَّهُمْ
enWisdom: Pretend to have forgotten the bad actions of your brothers and their affection [towards you] will last longer

Wisdom: حُسْنُ الْإِخَاءِ يُجْزِلُ الْأَجْرَ وَيُجْمِلُ الثَّنَاءَ
enWisdom: The embellishment of brotherhood is good companionship and [giving] support despite [financial] difficulty

Wisdom: رُبَّ صَدِيقٍ يُؤْتَى مِنْ جَهْلِهِ لَا مِنْ نِيَّتِهِ
enWisdom: Many a friend is scorned because of his ignorance, not because of his intention

Wisdom: رُبَّ أَخٍ لَمْ تَلِدْهُ أُمُّكَ
enWisdom: Many a brother has not been born to your mother

Wisdom: كُنْ بِعَدُوِّكَ الْعَاقِلِ أَوْثَقَ مِنْكَ بِصَدِيقِكَ الْجَاهِلِ
enWisdom: Take comfort for yourself in solitude rather than bad company

Wisdom: كُلَّمَا طَالَتِ الصُّحْبَةُ تَأَكَّدَتِ الْحُرْمَةُ
enWisdom: Be more confident of your intelligent foe than your ignorant friend

Wisdom: لَرُبَّمَا خَانَ النَّصِيحُ الْمُؤْتَمَنُ وَنَصَحَ الْمُسْتَخَانُ
enWisdom: Sometimes the reliable advisor may betray [you] and the one who is [deemed] disloyal may give good advice

Wisdom: لَيْسَ مَعَ الْخِلَافِ ائْتِلَافٌ
enWisdom: With disagreement there is no harmony

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَفْسَدَ صَدِيقَهُ نَقَصَ مِنْ عَدَدِهِ
enWisdom: One who spoils [his relationship with] his friend has reduced his own number

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَخَفَّ بِمَوَالِيهِ اسْتَثْقَلَ وَطْأَةَ مُعَادِيهِ
enWisdom: One who demands too much from his friend will sever his friendship

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَرْضَ مِنْ صَدِيقِهِ إِلَّا بِإِيثَارِهِ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ دَامَ سَخَطُهُ
enWisdom: One who is courteous to his companion will gain his acceptance, and one who is harsh to him will drive him away and get separated from him

Wisdom: مَا سَعِدَ مَنْ شَقِيَ إِخْوَانُهُ
enWisdom: He who makes his brothers miserable does not gain felicity

Wisdom: لَا تَسْتَحْسِنْ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ مَا مِنْ غَيْرِكَ تَسْتَنْكِرُهُ
enWisdom: Do not sanction for yourself that [action] which you would disapprove of from others

Wisdom: لَا تُوحِشَنَّ [لَا تُوحِشِ‏] امْرَأً يَسُوؤُكَ فِرَاقُهُ
enWisdom: Do not alienate a person whose separation will harm you

Wisdom: لَا تَتَمَسَّكَنَّ بِمُدْبِرٍ وَلَا تُفَارِقَنَّ مُقْبِلًا
enWisdom: Never hold on to one who turns back and do not separate from the one who moves forward

Wisdom: لَا تَبْذُلَنَّ وُدَّكَ إِذَا لَمْ تَجِدْ مَوْضِعاً
enWisdom: Never extend your friendship when you do not find a [suitable] place for it

Wisdom: لَا تَتَّخِذَنَّ عَدُوَّ صَدِيقِكَ صَدِيقاً فَتُعَادِيَ صَدِيقَكَ
enWisdom: Associating with the ignorant stems from lack of intelligence

Wisdom: لَا تُنَابِذْ عَدُوَّكَ وَلَا تُقَرِّعْ صَدِيقَكَ وَاقْبَلِ الْعُذْرَ وَإِنْ كَانَ كَذِباً وَدَعِ الْجَوَابَ عَنْ قُدْرَةٍ وَإِنْ كَانَ لَكَ
enWisdom: Do not declare your enmity to your enemy and do not rebuke your friend; and accept the excuse [you are given] even if it is a lie, and do not give [a forceful] response despite having the power to do so, even if it be your right

Wisdom: لَا تَسْتَكْثِرَنَّ مِنْ إِخْوَانِ الدُّنْيَا فَإِنَّكَ إِنْ عَجَزْتَ عَنْهُمْ تَحَوَّلُوا أَعْدَاءً وَإِنَّ مَثَلَهُمْ كَمَثَلِ النَّارِ كَثِيرُهَا يُحْرِقُ وَقَلِيلُهَا يَنْفَعُ
enWisdom: Do not frequent the company of a wicked person, for if you are bestowed with a blessing, he will envy you and if a misfortune befalls you, he will abandon you
